intro: Esenbeckia berlandieri subsp. berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican candelabra, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its branching, spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are often followed by distinctive, inflated seed pods. It is adapted to dry climates and can thrive in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology makes it a notable species in botanical studies and horticultural collections.
